title: Single Responsibility Principle
description: A class should have only one reason to change. Each class should have a single, well-defined responsibility.

title: Open/Closed Principle
description: Classes should be open for extension but closed for modification. Use inheritance and interfaces to extend functionality.

title: Liskov Substitution Principle
description: Derived classes must be substitutable for their base classes without altering program correctness.

title: Interface Segregation Principle
description: Clients should not depend on interfaces they don't use. Create specific interfaces for specific needs.

title: Dependency Inversion Principle
description: Depend on abstractions, not concretions. High-level modules shouldn't depend on low-level modules.

title: DRY - Don't Repeat Yourself
description: Avoid duplicating logic. Extract common code into reusable functions or classes.

title: KISS - Keep It Simple, Stupid
description: Write simple, straightforward code. Avoid unnecessary complexity and over-engineering.

title: YAGNI - You Aren't Gonna Need It
description: Don't implement features you don't currently need. Focus on present requirements.

title: Singleton Pattern
description: Ensures a class has only one instance and provides a global point of access to it.

title: Factory Pattern
description: Creates objects without specifying the exact classes. Uses factory methods to instantiate objects.

title: Observer Pattern
description: Defines a one-to-many dependency where when one object changes, all dependents are notified.

title: Strategy Pattern
description: Defines a family of interchangeable algorithms. Lets the algorithm vary independently.

title: Decorator Pattern
description: Attaches additional responsibilities to an object dynamically. Alternative to subclassing.

title: Adapter Pattern
description: Converts one interface to another. Allows incompatible interfaces to work together.

title: Binary Search
description: Divides search interval by half. Works on sorted data with O(log n) complexity.

title: Quick Sort
description: Divides array using a pivot element. Average O(n log n) complexity, fast in practice.

title: Merge Sort
description: Divides array in half, sorts, then merges. Guaranteed O(n log n) complexity.

title: Depth-First Search
description: Explores graph nodes by going as deep as possible before backtracking.

title: Breadth-First Search
description: Explores graph level by level. Uses queue for neighbor exploration.

title: Dynamic Programming
description: Solves problems by breaking them into overlapping subproblems with memoization.

title: Array/List Data Structure
description: Contiguous memory storing indexed elements. Constant time access, variable insertion/deletion.

title: Linked List
description: Nodes linked via pointers. O(n) access, O(1) insertion/deletion at known position.

title: Hash Table
description: Uses hash function to map keys to values. Average O(1) access, space-time tradeoff.

title: Stack
description: Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) structure. Push and pop in constant time.

title: Queue
description: First-In-First-Out (FIFO) structure. Enqueue and dequeue in constant time.

title: Binary Tree
description: Tree where each node has at most two children. Foundation for many tree applications.

title: Binary Search Tree
description: Binary tree where left child < parent < right child. Enables efficient searching.

title: Graph
description: Collection of nodes/vertices connected by edges/links. Represents relationships.

title: Unit Testing
description: Tests individual functions/methods in isolation. Verifies correct behavior with assertions.

title: Integration Testing
description: Tests multiple components working together. Verifies component interactions.

title: Mock Objects
description: Simulates behavior of real objects in tests. Isolates units for testing.

title: Code Coverage
description: Percentage of code executed by tests. Higher coverage indicates better testing.

title: Test-Driven Development
description: Write tests first, then implementation. Red-Green-Refactor cycle.

title: Naming Conventions
description: Use clear, descriptive names for variables, functions, and classes.

title: Comments and Documentation
description: Write clear comments explaining why, not what. Keep documentation updated.

title: Function Length
description: Keep functions small and focused. Easier to understand and test.

title: Error Handling
description: Handle exceptions gracefully. Provide meaningful error messages and recovery.

title: Git Basics
description: Version control system for tracking code changes. Commit, branch, merge operations.

title: Branching Strategy
description: Plan for creating and managing branches. GitFlow, GitHub Flow are common strategies.

title: Pull Requests
description: Request review of code changes before merging. Enables collaboration and quality control.

title: Commit Best Practices
description: Write atomic, descriptive commits. Each commit should represent a logical change.

title: Time Complexity
description: Measures how algorithm runtime grows with input size. O(n), O(log n), etc.

title: Space Complexity
description: Measures how algorithm memory usage grows with input size.

title: Caching
description: Store frequently accessed data to reduce lookup time. Improves performance.

title: Database Indexing
description: Create indexes on frequently queried columns. Significantly speeds up queries.

title: Load Balancing
description: Distribute traffic across servers. Improves availability and performance.

title: SQL Injection
description: Attacker inserts malicious SQL code into input fields. Prevention: parameterized queries.

title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
description: Attacker injects scripts into web pages. Prevention: output encoding and input validation.

title: Authentication
description: Verifies user identity through credentials. Different from authorization.

title: Authorization
description: Determines what authenticated user can access. Role-based access control.

title: Encryption
description: Converts readable data to unreadable format using keys. Protects sensitive information.

title: Relational Databases
description: Organize data into tables with relationships. SQL is standard query language.

title: NoSQL Databases
description: Non-relational databases with flexible schemas. Better for unstructured data.

title: Database Normalization
description: Organize data to reduce redundancy and improve consistency.

title: Transactions
description: Group operations that must succeed or fail together. Ensures data consistency.

title: REST API
description: Architecture for building web services using HTTP methods and resources.

title: HTTP Status Codes
description: Server responses indicating request outcome. 200-299 success, 400+ errors.

title: Cookies and Sessions
description: Store client/server state across requests. Different purposes and security considerations.

title: CORS - Cross-Origin Resource Sharing
description: Allows requests from different domains. Prevents unauthorized cross-origin access.

title: MVC Architecture
description: Separates application into Model, View, Controller. Improves organization and testability.

title: Microservices
description: Break application into small, independent services. Increases flexibility and scalability.

title: Monolithic Architecture
description: Single, unified application with all components tightly coupled.

title: Layered Architecture
description: Organize application into layers (presentation, business, data). Separation of concerns.

title: Dependency Injection
description: Provide objects with their dependencies. Improves testability and reduces coupling.

title: OAuth 2.0
description: Authorization framework for delegated access. Allows third-party apps to access resources.

title: API Rate Limiting
description: Restrict number of requests from clients. Prevents abuse and ensures fair usage.

title: Continuous Integration
description: Automatically test and integrate code changes. Catches issues early.

title: Continuous Deployment
description: Automatically deploy code to production. Enables rapid release cycles.

title: Docker Containers
description: Package application with dependencies in containers. Ensures consistency across environments.

title: Kubernetes Orchestration
description: Manages containerized applications at scale. Handles deployment, scaling, and networking.

title: Regex - Regular Expressions
description: Pattern matching for text. Powerful for validation and parsing.

title: Object-Oriented Programming
description: Design paradigm using objects with properties and methods. Supports inheritance and polymorphism.

title: Functional Programming
description: Paradigm using functions as first-class values. Emphasizes immutability and pure functions.

title: Recursion
description: Function calls itself with simpler inputs. Useful for tree/graph problems.

title: Polymorphism
description: Objects of different types respond to same message differently.

title: Encapsulation
description: Bundle data and methods together, hiding internal details. Controls access.

title: Abstraction
description: Hide complexity behind simple interface. Users work with abstractions, not implementations.

title: Inheritance
description: Create new classes from existing ones. Promotes code reuse and hierarchy.

title: Composition over Inheritance
description: Favor composition to build complex objects. More flexible than inheritance.

title: Thread Safety
description: Code that works correctly with multiple threads. No race conditions or data corruption.

title: Race Conditions
description: Unintended behavior when threads access shared data simultaneously.

title: Deadlock
description: Threads waiting for each other indefinitely. Prevents progress.

title: Async/Await
description: Write asynchronous code that looks synchronous. Improves readability.

title: Callbacks
description: Pass function as argument to be called later. Foundation for asynchronous programming.

title: Promises
description: Represent eventual result of async operation. Better than callbacks.

title: Memory Leaks
description: Unreleased memory accumulates over time. Causes performance degradation.

title: Garbage Collection
description: Automatically reclaim memory of unused objects. Simplifies memory management.

title: Polymorphic Dispatch
description: Choose method implementation based on object type at runtime.

title: Template Method Pattern
description: Define algorithm skeleton, let subclasses fill in steps.

title: State Pattern
description: Encapsulate object behavior that varies with state.

title: Facade Pattern
description: Provide simplified interface to complex subsystem.

title: Builder Pattern
description: Construct complex objects step by step. Separates construction from representation.

title: Prototype Pattern
description: Create objects by copying existing prototype. Avoids expensive creation.

title: Chain of Responsibility
description: Pass request along chain of handlers. Each decides to handle or pass along.

title: Command Pattern
description: Encapsulate request as object. Allows parameterization and queuing.

title: Visitor Pattern
description: Represent operation to be performed on elements of object structure.

title: Iterator Pattern
description: Access elements of collection sequentially without exposing structure.

title: Mediator Pattern
description: Encapsulate how objects interact. Reduces coupling between communicating objects.

title: Memento Pattern
description: Capture and externalize object state without violating encapsulation.

title: Proxy Pattern
description: Provide surrogate or placeholder for another object. Controls access.
